name: latitudesh
long_description: Latitude.sh API: The Latitude.sh API is a RESTful API to manage your Latitude.sh account. It allows you to perform the same actions as the Latitude.sh dashboard.

tools.name: api-keys-list
tools.description:
List API Keys

Returns a list of all API keys from the team members

tools.name: api-keys-create
tools.description:
Create API Key

Create a new API Key that is tied to the current user account. The created API key is only listed ONCE upon creation. It can however be regenerated or deleted.

tools.name: api-keys-update
tools.description:
Regenerate API Key

Regenerate an existing API Key that is tied to the current user. This overrides the previous key.

tools.name: api-keys-delete
tools.description:
Delete API Key

Delete an existing API Key. Once deleted, the API Key can no longer be used to access the API.

tools.name: billing-list-usage
tools.description:
List Billing Usage

Returns the billing usage of a project

tools.name: events-list
tools.description:
List all Events

Lists all events.

tools.name: firewalls-get-all-firewall-assignments
tools.description:
List All Firewall Assignments

List all firewall assignments

tools.name: firewalls-list
tools.description:
List firewalls

List firewalls

tools.name: firewalls-create
tools.description:
Create a firewall

Create a firewall

tools.name: firewalls-get
tools.description:
Retrieve Firewall

Retrieve a firewall

tools.name: firewalls-delete
tools.description:
Delete Firewall

Delete a firewall

tools.name: firewalls-update
tools.description:
Update Firewall

Update a firewall

tools.name: firewalls-list-assignments
tools.description:
Firewall Assignments

List servers assigned to a firewall

tools.name: firewalls-delete-assignment
tools.description:
Delete Firewall Assignment

Remove a server from a firewall

tools.name: firewalls-assignments-create
tools.description:
Firewall Assignment

Assign a server to a firewall

tools.name: ip-addresses-list
tools.description:
List IPs

List all Management and Additional IP Addresses.
 • Management IPs are IPs that are used for the management IP of a device.
   This is a public IP address that a device is born and dies with. It never changes during the lifecycle of the device.
 • Additional IPs are individual IPs that can be added to a device as an additional IP that can be used.

tools.name: ip-addresses-get
tools.description:
Retrieve an IP

Retrieve an IP Address

tools.name: teams-members-get-team-members
tools.description: List all Team Members

tools.name: team-members-post-team-members
tools.description: Add a Team Member

tools.name: team-members-delete
tools.description: Remove a Team Member

tools.name: operating-systems-list-plans
tools.description:
List all operating systems available

Lists all operating systems available to deploy and reinstall.

tools.name: plans-list
tools.description:
List all Plans

Lists all plans. Availability by region is included in \`attributes.regions.locations.available[*]\` node for a given plan.

tools.name: plans-get
tools.description: Retrieve a Plan

tools.name: plans-get-bandwidth
tools.description:
List all bandwidth plans

Lists all bandwidth plans.

tools.name: plans-update-bandwidth
tools.description:
Buy or remove bandwidth packages

Allows to increase or decrease bandwidth packages. Only admins and owners can request.

tools.name: plans-get-containers-plan
tools.description:
Retrieve container plan

Retrieve a container plan.

tools.name: plans-list-storage
tools.description: List all Storage Plans

tools.name: plans-vm-list
tools.description: List all Virtual Machines Plans

tools.name: projects-list
tools.description:
List all Projects

Returns a list of all projects for the current team

tools.name: projects-create
tools.description: Create a Project

tools.name: projects-delete
tools.description: Delete a Project

tools.name: projects-update
tools.description: Update a Project

tools.name: SSH-keys-list
tools.description:
List all Project SSH Keys

List all SSH Keys in the project. These keys can be used to access servers after deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: SSH-keys-get
tools.description:
Retrieve a Project SSH Key

List all SSH Keys in the project. These keys can be used to access servers after deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: SSH-keys-remove-from-project
tools.description:
Delete a Project SSH Key

Allow you remove SSH Keys in a project. Remove a SSH Key from the project won't revoke the SSH Keys access for previously deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: SSH-keys-modify-project-key
tools.description:
Update a Project SSH Key

Allow you update SSH Key in a project. These keys can be used to access servers after deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: SSH-keys-list-all
tools.description:
List all SSH Keys

List all SSH Keys in the project. These keys can be used to access servers after deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: SSH-keys-create
tools.description:
Create a SSH Key

Allows you create SSH Keys. These keys can be used to access servers after deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: SSH-keys-retrieve
tools.description:
Retrieve a SSH Key

List all SSH Keys in the project. These keys can be used to access servers after deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: SSH-keys-delete
tools.description:
Delete a SSH Key

Allows you remove SSH Keys in a project. Remove a SSH Key from the project won't revoke the SSH Keys access for previously deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: SSH-keys-update
tools.description:
Update a SSH Key

Allows you update SSH Key in a project. These keys can be used to access servers after deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: projects-ssh-keys-post-project-ssh-key
tools.description:
Create a Project SSH Key

Allow you create SSH Keys in a project. These keys can be used to access servers after deploy and reinstall actions.

tools.name: user-data-get-project-users-data
tools.description:
List all Project User Data

List all Users Data in the project. These scripts can be used to configure servers with user data.

tools.name: user-data-get-project-user-data
tools.description:
Retrieve a Project User Data

Get User Data in the project. These scripts can be used to configure servers with user data.

tools.name: user-data-delete-project-user-data
tools.description:
Delete a Project User Data

Allow you remove User Data in a project.

tools.name: user-data-create
tools.description:
Create a Project User Data

Allows you to create User Data in a project, which can be used to perform custom setup on your servers after deploy and reinstall.

tools.name: user-data-update-for-project
tools.description:
Update a Project User Data

Allow you update User Data in a project.

tools.name: user-data-list
tools.description:
List all User Data

List all Users Data in the project. These scripts can be used to configure servers with user data.

tools.name: user-data-create-new
tools.description:
Create an User Data

Allows you to create User Data in a team, which can be used to perform custom setup on your servers after deploy and reinstall.

tools.name: user-data-retrieve
tools.description:
Retrieve an User Data

Get User Data in the project. These scripts can be used to configure servers with user data.

tools.name: user-data-delete
tools.description: Delete an User Data

tools.name: user-data-update
tools.description:
Update an User Data

Allow you update User Data in a team.

tools.name: regions-get
tools.description:
List all Regions

Lists all [available locations](https://latitude.sh/locations). For server availability by location, please see the [Plans API](/reference/get-plans).

tools.name: regions-fetch
tools.description: Retrieve a Region

tools.name: roles-list
tools.description:
List all Roles

Returns a list of all roles that can be assigned to users

tools.name: roles-get
tools.description: Retrieve Role

tools.name: servers-list
tools.description:
List all Servers

Returns a list of all servers belonging to the team.

tools.name: servers-create
tools.description: Deploy Server

tools.name: servers-get
tools.description:
Retrieve a Server

Returns a server that belongs to the team.

tools.name: servers-delete
tools.description: Remove Server

tools.name: servers-update
tools.description: Update Server

tools.name: servers-get-deploy-config
tools.description: Retrieve Deploy Config

tools.name: servers-update-deploy-config
tools.description: Update Deploy Config

tools.name: servers-lock
tools.description:
Lock the server

Locks the server. A locked server cannot be deleted or modified and no actions can be performed on it.

tools.name: servers-unlock
tools.description:
Unlock the server

Unlocks the server. A locked server cannot be deleted or modified and no actions can be performed on it.

tools.name: servers-get-out-of-band
tools.description: List Out of Band Connections

tools.name: servers-start-out-of-band-connection
tools.description: Start Out of Band Connection

tools.name: servers-run-action
tools.description:
Run Server Action

Performs an action on a given server:
- \`power_on\`
- \`power_off\`
- \`reboot\`

tools.name: servers-create-ipmi-session
tools.description:
Generate IPMI credentials

Generates IPMI credentials for a given server. Remote access creates a VPN connection to the internal network of your server so you can connect to its IPMI.
You will have to use a VPN client such as https://openvpn.net to connect. See \`VPN Sessions\` API to create a VPN connection.

Related guide: https://docs.latitude.sh/docs/ipmi

tools.name: servers-start-rescue-mode
tools.description:
Puts a Server in rescue mode

Starts rescue mode on a given server.

tools.name: servers-exit-rescue-mode
tools.description:
Exits rescue mode for a Server

Exits rescue mode on a given server.

tools.name: servers-schedule-deletion
tools.description:
Schedule the server deletion

Schedules the server to be removed at the end of the billing cycle.

tools.name: servers-unschedule-deletion
tools.description:
Unschedule the server deletion

Unschedules the server removal at the end of the billing cycle.

tools.name: servers-reinstall
tools.description: Run Server Reinstall

tools.name: storage-list-filesystems
tools.description:
List filesystems

Lists all the filesystems from a team.

tools.name: storage-create-filesystem
tools.description:
Create a filesystem for a project

Allows you to add persistent storage to a project. These filesystems can be used to store data across your servers.

tools.name: storage-delete-filesystem
tools.description:
Delete a filesystem for a project

Allows you to remove persistent storage from a project.

tools.name: storage-update-filesystem
tools.description:
Update a filesystem for a project

Allow you to upgrade the size of a filesystem.

tools.name: storage-get-storage-volumes
tools.description:
List volumes

Lists all the volumes from a team.

tools.name: storage-post-storage-volumes
tools.description:
Create volume

Allows you to add persistent storage to a project. These volumes can be used to store data across your servers.

tools.name: storage-post-storage-volumes-mount
tools.description:
Mount volume

Mounts volume storage by adding the client to an allowed list

tools.name: storage-get-storage-volume
tools.description:
Get volume

Shows details of a specific volume storage.

tools.name: storage-delete-storage-volumes
tools.description:
Delete volume

Allows you to remove persistent storage from a project.

tools.name: tags-list
tools.description:
List all Tags

List all Tags in the team.

tools.name: tags-create
tools.description:
Create a Tag

Create a Tag in the team.

tools.name: tags-delete
tools.description:
Delete Tag

Update a Tag in the team.

tools.name: tags-update
tools.description:
Update Tag

Update a Tag in the team.

tools.name: teams-get
tools.description: Retrieve the team

tools.name: teams-create
tools.description: Create a team

tools.name: teams-update
tools.description: Update a team

tools.name: traffic-get
tools.description: Retrieve Traffic consumption

tools.name: traffic-get-quota
tools.description: Retrieve Traffic Quota

tools.name: user-profile-get
tools.description:
Get user profile

Retrieve the current user profile

tools.name: user-profile-update
tools.description:
Update User Profile

Update the current user profile

tools.name: user-profile-list-teams
tools.description:
List User Teams

Returns a list of all teams the user belongs to

tools.name: virtual-machines-list
tools.description:
Get Teams Virtual Machines

Show all Team's Virtual Machines.

tools.name: virtual-machines-create
tools.description:
Create a Virtual Machine

Creates a new Virtual Machine.

tools.name: virtual-machines-get
tools.description:
Get a Virtual Machine

Show a Virtual Machine.

tools.name: virtual-machines-delete
tools.description:
Destroy a Virtual Machine

Destroys a Virtual Machine.

tools.name: virtual-machines-create-virtual-machine-action
tools.description:
Run Virtual Machine Action

Performs a power action on a given virtual machine:
- \`power_on\` - Starts the virtual machine
- \`power_off\` - Stops the virtual machine
- \`reboot\` - Restarts the virtual machine

tools.name: private-networks-list
tools.description:
List all Virtual Networks

Lists virtual networks assigned to a project

tools.name: private-networks-create
tools.description:
Create a Virtual Network

Creates a new Virtual Network.

tools.name: private-networks-get
tools.description:
Retrieve a Virtual Network

Retrieve a Virtual Network.

tools.name: private-networks-update
tools.description:
Update a Virtual Network

Update a Virtual Network.

tools.name: private-networks-list-assignments
tools.description:
List all servers assigned to virtual networks

Returns a list of all servers assigned to virtual networks.

tools.name: private-networks-assign
tools.description: Assign Virtual network

tools.name: private-networks-delete-assignment
tools.description:
Delete Virtual Network Assignment

Allow you to remove a Virtual Network assignment.

tools.name: virtual-networks-delete
tools.description:
Delete a Virtual Network

Delete virtual network

tools.name: vpn-sessions-list
tools.description: List all Active VPN Sessions

tools.name: vpn-sessions-create
tools.description:
Create a VPN Session

Creates a new VPN Session.
\`NOTE:\` The VPN credentials are only listed ONCE upon creation. They can however be refreshed or deleted.

tools.name: vpn-sessions-refresh-password
tools.description:
Refresh a VPN Session

Refreshing an existing VPN Session will create new credentials for that session

tools.name: vpn-sessions-delete
tools.description:
Delete a VPN Session

Deletes an existing VPN Session.

bearer.title: Bearer
bearer.description: The Bearer to use for the request
